quad_esl57.name: Quad ESL-57
notes: Avoid sweeps below 40 Hz – risk of panel arcing.
Perform measurements at moderate levels only.
Best imaging when speakers cross slightly behind listening position.
Keep at least 1m from rear wall.

quad_esl63.name: Quad ESL-63
notes: Modelled point-source radiation – imaging is precise.
Distance from rear wall affects midrange bloom.
Works well with small toe-in.
Avoid overdriving; panels saturate quickly.

gale_gs401.name: Gale GS401
notes: Sealed bass: tight, needs breathing room.
Correct crossover at 475 Hz and 5000 Hz.
Tweeter pots often drift – ensure both rotate freely.
Aim for 'glacial water' mid clarity by balancing toe-in.
Slight rear wall distance increases coherence.

quad_11l_classic.name: Quad 11L Classic
notes: Bookshelf with sweet mid-forward tonality.
Works best slightly closer together and off the wall.
Toe-in improves treble definition.

kef_ls50_meta.name: KEF LS50 Meta
notes: Point-source Uni-Q: wide sweet spot.
Sensitive to boundary reflections – avoid nearby furniture.
Toe-in 10° gives best focus.

bw_805d3.name: Bowers & Wilkins 805 D3
notes: Exceptional imaging when positioned well.
Benefits from solid stands.
Rear-ported – keep off rear wall for tight bass.
